SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.jaunt
Class UserAgentSettings

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt.UserAgentSettings

public class UserAgentSettings
extends Object

Represents UserAgent settings. The following are the default values, available from the toString() method: 

  SETTINGS:
  charset: UTF-8
  outputPath: <<System.getProperty("user.dir")>>
  autoRedirect: true
  maxRedirects: 5
  showWarnings: false
  showHeaders: false
  checkSSLCerts: true
  autoSaveAsHTML: false
  autoSaveAsXML: false
  defaultRequestHeaders:
    accept: ∗/∗
    accept-language: en-us
    accept-encoding: gzip
    connection: Keep-Alive
    user-agent: Jaunt/0.9.x

Since:
0.9.0
Author:
Tom Cervenka

Field Summary
 boolean autoRedirect
          UserAgent setting indicating whether to automatically follow meta tag redirects that occur in the head section.
 boolean autoSaveAsHTML
          UserAgent setting indicating whether to automatically save the source of each visited page as HTML in index.htm.
 boolean autoSaveAsXML
          UserAgent setting indicating whether to automatically save the source of each visited page as XHTML in index.xml.
 String charset
          UserAgent setting indicating which Charset encoding to use - supports canonical name or an alias.
 boolean checkSSLCerts
          UserAgent setting indicating whether to check SSL certificates for validity or blindly trust all certificates (including self-signed certificates).
 int connectTimeout
          UserAgent setting indicating milliseconds until timeout occurs waiting for connection.
 Map<String,String> defaultRequestHeaders
          Map holding the default headers that the UserAgent sends with every HttpRequest; keys are header names (eg "user-agent") and values are header values (eg "Jaunt/0.9.x")
 boolean genericXMLMode
          Whether to parse content as generic XML (ie, non-XHTML); this mode enables faster XML parsing since XHTML components (forms, etc) are not created.
 int maxBytes
          UserAgent setting indicating the maximum number of bytes of response content processed by the parser, after which point no more data is read and any remaining open tags are closed; the value -1 indicates no limit
 int maxRedirects
          UserAgent setting indicating the maximum number of consecutive redirects to attempt before failing.
 String outputPath
          UserAgent setting indicating the output folder for save-related methods; the default value is System.getProperty("user.dir");
 int readTimeout
          UserAgent setting indicating milliseconds until timeout occurs waiting for socket to read.
 boolean showHeaders
          UserAgent setting indicating whether to print HTTP request headers and response headers to System.out.
 boolean showWarnings
          UserAgent setting indicating whether to print warning messages to System.out.
 
Method Summary
 String toString()
           
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

UserAgent setting indicating whether to print HTTP request headers and response headers to System.out.

genericXMLMode

public boolean genericXMLMode
Whether to parse content as generic XML (ie, non-XHTML); this mode enables faster XML parsing since XHTML components (forms, etc) are not created.

checkSSLCerts

public boolean checkSSLCerts
UserAgent setting indicating whether to check SSL certificates for validity or blindly trust all certificates (including self-signed certificates).

public boolean autoSaveAsHTML
UserAgent setting indicating whether to automatically save the source of each visited page as HTML in index.htm.

autoSaveAsXML

public boolean autoSaveAsXML
UserAgent setting indicating whether to automatically save the source of each visited page as XHTML in index.xml.

outputPath

public String outputPath
UserAgent setting indicating the output folder for save-related methods; the default value is System.getProperty("user.dir");

maxRedirects

public int maxRedirects
UserAgent setting indicating the maximum number of consecutive redirects to attempt before failing.

maxBytes

public int maxBytes
UserAgent setting indicating the maximum number of bytes of response content processed by the parser, after which point no more data is read and any remaining open tags are closed; the value -1 indicates no limit

defaultRequestHeaders

public Map<String,String> defaultRequestHeaders
Map holding the default headers that the UserAgent sends with every HttpRequest; keys are header names (eg "user-agent") and values are header values (eg "Jaunt/0.9.x")

UserAgent setting indicating milliseconds until timeout occurs waiting for connection.

UserAgent setting indicating milliseconds until timeout occurs waiting for socket to read.
